articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli air strikes killed at least 50 Palestinians in Gaza, local health authorities said, as Israel continues its bombardment despite mounting international pressure to stop military operations and allow aid into Gaza unimpeded.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill dozens in Gaza as criticism of Israel grows

articles.author: Julia Payne
articles.description: The EU adopted four sets of sanctions against Russia over the war in Ukraine on Tuesday, including a 17th package targeting Moscow's shadow fleet, and measures related to chemical weapons, human rights and hybrid threats, the European Commission said on Tuesday.
articles.title: EU countries adopt four sets of new Russia sanctions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran received and is reviewing a proposal for a fifth round of nuclear talks with the United States, Deputy Foreign Minister Kazem Gharibabadi said on Tuesday, according to state media.
articles.title: Iran reviewing proposal for 5th round of nuclear talks

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Andreas Rinke, John Irish
articles.description: For Ukraine and its allies, who spent months trying to win Donald Trump over to their cause in the war started by Russia, it is back to square one.
articles.title: Trump-Putin call on war in Ukraine is another blow to Kyiv and its allies

articles.author: Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: Members of the World Health Organization adopted an agreement on Tuesday to better prepare for future pandemics following the disjointed global response to COVID-19, but the absence of the U.S. cast doubt on the treaty's effectiveness.
articles.title: WHO members adopt global pandemic accord but US absence casts doubts

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: A U.S.-backed organization aims to start work in the Gaza Strip by the end of May overseeing a new model of aid distribution in the Palestinian enclave, but the United Nations says the plan is not impartial or neutral, and it won't be involved.
articles.title: What is the new US-backed Gaza aid plan and why doesn't the UN like it ?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain on Tuesday paused free trade talks with Israel, summoned its ambassador, and announced further sanctions against West Bank settlers after Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he was horrified by the military escalation in Gaza.
articles.title: UK suspends trade talks with Israel over new Gaza offensive

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs once took an ecstasy pill shaped like President Barack Obama's face, the hip-hop mogul's former personal assistant testified on Tuesday at Combs' racketeering and sex trafficking trial.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs took ecstasy shaped like Obama's face, jury hears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Mexican ship which crashed into New York's Brooklyn Bridge over the weekend did not make distress calls before ramming into the bridge, the head of Mexico's navy said on Tuesday, but rather called for support.
articles.title: Mexican ship that crashed into Brooklyn Bridge made no distress calls, Mexico says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Uganda's parliament on Tuesday passed an amended law that permits military tribunals to try civilians, prompting protests from the opposition who said the move violated a Supreme Court ruling in January that banned such trials.
articles.title: Uganda passes law to restore military prosecutions of civilians
